channel.title: ClickingButtons link [PI]
channel.description: What code is it that you use to make a button in ClickingButtons.java take you to a link?

item.title: ClickingButtons link [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

c.getPA().sendFrame126(www.google.com, 12000);

He’s right, but he needed to add the ‘www.’ and the 12000 is the frame the server sends to the client telling it to open up a website via the launch url method

126 is the packet ID sent to the client.

Read full topic

item.title: ClickingButtons link [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:4, topic:416383”]I don’t think that would work without the “launchURL” method its self.

Don’t know how this method would work inside clickingbuttons.java, usually its launched client sided, from gui.java

[code] public void launchURL(String s) {
String s1 = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
try {

        if(s1.startsWith("Windows")) {
            Runtime.getRuntime().exec((new StringBuilder()).append("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler ").append(s).toString());
        } else {
            String as[] = {"firefox", "opera", "konqueror", "epiphany", "mozilla", "netscape"};
            String s2 = null;
            for(int i = 0; i < as.length && s2 == null; i++)
                if(Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
"which", as[i]

}).waitFor() == 0)
s2 = as[i];

            if(s2 == null)
                throw new Exception("Could not find web browser");
            Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
                s2, s
            });
        }
    }
    catch(Exception exception)
    {
        System.out.println("An error occured while trying to open the web browser!\n");
    }
}[/code]

Basically finding your operating system, and where your web Browser is so it can launch.[/quote]
That’s already set in every PI base retard.

smokin flax:

erm, whats the 12000? number of directs? or is that the frame to send?

Yep.

Read full topic

item.title: ClickingButtons link [PI]
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

I don’t think that would work without the “launchURL” method its self.

Don’t know how this method would work inside clickingbuttons.java, usually its launched client sided, from gui.java

[code] public void launchURL(String s) {
String s1 = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
try {

        if(s1.startsWith("Windows")) {
            Runtime.getRuntime().exec((new StringBuilder()).append("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler ").append(s).toString());
        } else {
            String as[] = {"firefox", "opera", "konqueror", "epiphany", "mozilla", "netscape"};
            String s2 = null;
            for(int i = 0; i < as.length && s2 == null; i++)
                if(Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
"which", as[i]

}).waitFor() == 0)
s2 = as[i];

            if(s2 == null)
                throw new Exception("Could not find web browser");
            Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
                s2, s
            });
        }
    }
    catch(Exception exception)
    {
        System.out.println("An error occured while trying to open the web browser!\n");
    }
}[/code]

Basically finding your operating system, and where your web Browser is so it can launch.

Read full topic
